articles.author: Eric Lipton, Dionne Searcey, Ashley Gilbertson
articles.title: How the U.S. Lost Ground to China in the Contest for Clean Energy - The New York Times
articles.description: Americans failed to safeguard decades of diplomatic and financial investments in Congo, where the world’s largest supply of cobalt is controlled by Chinese companies backed by Beijing.
articles.content:
Everybody thought, boy, this is the grand reopening, a new awakening of Congo, Mr. Mollison said.
Western mining executives and their Wall Street bankers, smelling opportunity in the changing leader… [+1650 chars]

articles.title: 50 years on, mystery hijacker's mid-air escape still fascinates Americans - News24
articles.description: Fifty years after his leap into the unknown, the case of D.B. Cooper - an alias spawned by the media - remains the only unsolved plane hijacking in the history of the United States.
articles.content:
• Fifty years after his leap into the unknown, the case of D.B. Cooper remains the only unsolved plane hijacking in the history of the United States.
